summary: This document is a chain of emails between federal prosecutors and defense attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom regarding scheduling a meeting and an attorney proffer for a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) who received a grand jury subpoena. It discusses holding the subpoena in abeyance, sharing evidence including threatening communications and phone records, and coordinating meeting times.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Defense Attorney, Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena; she is coordinating a meeting and proffer with the SDNY prosecution team.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Associate attorney copied on emails, involved in scheduling and confirming meetings with the prosecution.

persons.name: Cristina I. Calvar
persons.context: Copied on emails regarding the grand jury subpoena and meeting scheduling.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of a client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Both are legal professionals at Winston & Strawn LLP, with Calvar being copied on case-related emails.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The SDNY issued a grand jury subpoena to an individual (client of Suzanne Jaffe Bloom).

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoenaed individual was to appear before the grand jury; this was adjourned and held in abeyance.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: A proposed date for a meeting between the defense attorneys and SDNY prosecutors to discuss the case and a potential proffer.

events.title: Rescheduled Meeting Dates
events.description: Discussions to reschedule the meeting to August 26, 27, or 28 due to a prosecutor's trial schedule.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A client of attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom received an SDNY grand jury subpoena dated July 5, 2019, and the initial appearance date of July 24, 2019, was adjourned.
Prosecutors indicated they possess contemporaneous telephone records from a cell phone registered to the client, showing calls with multiple underage girls.
The defense reported that the client's husband had received threatening communications, an example of which was attached to an email.
Discussions centered on scheduling an attorney proffer meeting, with the prosecution providing an example of their standard proffer agreement and docket numbers for related civil cases.
